page.title: 12Milk Round In Glossop
page.content: The owners of{Hall Fold Farm}have{ {60 milk cows.}(see previous page). The cows are milked at{7am}and{6.30pm. They produce{700 litres}of milk per day.{Two hundred litres}are kept to be sold on the milk round and the rest is sent to the dairy. The milk is stored in large stainless steel storage tanks in the milking parlour. It is taken away by tanker for bottling. The farmer owns{two}milk floats which deliver milk to the surrounding area including the whole of{Glossop, {Simmondley}and part of{Hadfield.}They start on the milk round at{7am}and finish at{5pm.} The main dairy breed is the{ {friesian}and the farmer breeds all his own cattle. The farm is near a busy main road and the noise is at times a nuisance to the cattle.
